intro: Munnozia filipes, commonly known as the slender muhly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial grass that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale blue to purple flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Munnozia filipes is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
